item.title: Michael add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "The lost glove is happy." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Michael add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "I was the shadow of the waxwing slain By the false azure in the windowpane; I was the smudge of ashen fluff -and I Lived on, flew on, in the reflected sky. And from the inside, too, I'd duplicate Myself, my lamp, an apple on a plate: Uncurtaining the night, I'd let dark glass Hang all the furniture above the grass, And how delightful when a fall of snow Covered my glimpse of lawn and reached up so As to make chair and bed exactly stand Upon that snow, out in that crystal land!" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Michael add a quote by Tatyana Tolstaya
item.description: "That's what poems are for, so you don't understand a thing." -- Tatyana Tolstaya

item.title: Michael add a quote by Gilles Deleuze
item.description: "Writing has nothing to do with meaning. It has to do with landsurveying and cartography, including the mapping of countries yet to come." -- Gilles Deleuze

item.title: Michael add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "If you could just ravel out into time. That would be nice. It would be nice if you could just ravel out into time" -- William Faulkner

item.title: Michael add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "...the aim of civilization is to translate everything into enjoyment." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Michael add a quote by Michel Houellebecq
item.description:
"it’s true this world our breathing laboured inspires nothing more than obvious disgust a desire to flee without our share and no longer read the headlines
we long to return to our ancestral home where our forebears once lived under an angel’s wing we long to find that strange morality which sanctified life to the end
we crave something like loyalty like the embrace of mild addictions something that transcends yet contains life we cannot live far from eternity" -- Michel Houellebecq

item.title: Michael add a quote by Robert Musil
item.description: "One must conform to the baseness of an age or become neurotic." -- Robert Musil

item.title: Michael add a quote by Robert Musil
item.description: "There is, in short, no great idea that stupidity could not put to its own uses [....] The truth by comparison, has only one appearance and only one path, and is always at a disadvantage." -- Robert Musil

item.title: Michael add a quote by Robert G. Ingersoll
item.description: "There are in nature neither rewards nor punishments — there are consequences." -- Robert G. Ingersoll
